Posts.Content: Redsofa15 wrote: Hi all, I firstly found this lump so I thought about 8months ago. It was about the size of a 20p, I left this lump thinking I was to young for breast cancer and maybe it was hormone related. I'm 25 btw. It wasn't until last week on Friday I woke with shooting pains in my right breast and armpit. This lump? thickening? So the GP called it had grown, it is at least 3-4cm now and very hard. It is slightly mobile but it's very superfical and is hard. No soft and very mobile as it was 8months ago. The edging of this thickening is very weird, almost like its layed if u must? It feel like a lump on top of a bigger lump. But again I was told today by GP that's its 'mobile' which they suggest is good right? She has sent me a referral off and said i should receieved my letter by the end of the week that's if they don't phone me sooner. I'm so worried and feel a fool for leaving it so long :(  Thanks for listening xx Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Thickening in right breast waiting for appointment. Redsofa15 Redsofa15

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2014 10:59PM Redsofa15 wrote: hey hun, Thank you for your reply. It's mad really about the thickening bit isn't it? I was even reading the examination page in the local newspaper and that never said anything about  thickening was just about lumps? I'm very open to all tests and If advised to do so will have any one they recommend. thank you for taking your time hun xx

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2014 08:52AM Redsofa15 wrote: I forgot to add but can mastitis cause scar tissue?? I had a severe case of mastitis 5years ago after feeding and expressing for my premature baby. Would that be a possibility? Thanks ladies. X
